custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT connect to %s %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Connect to a broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. username (some brokers need this) 2. password (some brokers need this) 3. keepalive (default time is 60 seconds but some brokers need a shorter time) 4. connection callback (ringed set of scripts to be run when connection is made or remade) Note: The connection callback doesn''t have to be the 4th option - it just has to be the last (or only) option. ADVANCED: The brokers offered in the menu are accessed using default ports and basepaths (if needed). If accessing other brokers, the complete urls should be formed like this: siteURL:port/basepath e.g mqtt.eclipseprojects.io:443/mqtt It is possible to have more than one connection to the same broker, for instance, using two different user/pass accounts simultaneously. To do this, add a connection id at the end of the broker: e.g mqtt.eclipseprojects.io:443/mqtt|1

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl on each message run %'callback' $nl $options-1-192-192-192 %'options'
block-definition.comment: Subscribe to a topic on a broker Make sure you have already run an MQTT connect block before using this one You should add a script to be run inside he grey ring. It will be run each time a message is received If you click on the arrow on the grey ring twice, you can use #1 and #2 inside your script. #1 will contain the received payload #2 will contain the received topic name The options are not required but can be filled if needed There is only 1 option at present 1. Buffer mode (boolean) Default (false) - payload is returned as text If true, payload returned as single column list of values in the range of 0 to 255..

Publish a message to an MQTT broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. qos (quality of service 0,1 or 2) 2. retain flag (boolean) 3. Buffer mode (boolean). Default (false) - the payload is published as text If set to true then payload is expected to be a single column list of values in the 0 to 255 range and is published to the broker as a buffer of bytes. Note: If the payload is a list and you don't set the buffer mode option, it will be automatically be converted into JSON and sent as text.

1. Subscribe buffer mode (boolean) Default (false) - received payload is returned as text. If true, subscribed, received payload returned as single column list of values in the range of 0 to 255.. Default (false) - it is returned as text 2. Published buffer mode (boolean). Default (false) - the payload is published as text. If set to true then published payload is expected to be a single column list of values in the 0 to 255 range and is published to the broker as a buffer of bytes. Note: If the payload is a list and you don't set the buffer mode option, it will be automatically be converted into JSON and sent as text

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT publish to %s topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT request %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl response topic %'rtopic' payload %'payload' $nl on response run %'callback' $nl $options-1-192-192-192 %'options'
block-definition.comment: The options are not required but can be filled if needed. 1. Subscribe buffer mode (boolean) Default (false) - received payload is returned as text. If true, subscribed, received payload returned as single column list of values in the range of 0 to 255.. 2. Inform response topic (boolean): If true, the response topic is added at the end of the call topic after @ sign. The default condition (true) response topic is added. 3. Published buffer mode (boolean). Default (false) - the payload is published as text. If set to true then published payload is expected to be a single column list of values in the 0 to 255 range and is published to the broker as a buffer of bytes. Note: If the payload is a list and you don't set the buffer mode option, it will be automatically be converted into JSON and sent as text

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT publish to %s topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT example response reporter payload %'payload' topic %'topic'
block-definition.comment: This is a simple echo example. Topic can be used to filter the response.

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT request %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl response topic %'rtopic' payload %'payload' $nl $options-1-192-192-192 %'options'
block-definition.comment: The response topic should be a unique value for each call e.g. use timer The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. Timeout value - default is 3 seconds 2. Subscribe buffer mode (boolean) Default (false) - received payload is returned as text. If true, subscribed, received payload returned as single column list of values in the range of 0 to 255.. Default (false) - it is returned as text 3. Inform response topic (boolean): If true, the response topic is added at the end of the call topic after @ sign. The default condition (true) response topic is added. 4. Published buffer mode (boolean). Default (false) - the payload is published as text. If set to true then published payload is expected to be a single column list of values in the 0 to 255 range and is published to the broker as a buffer of bytes. Note: If the payload is a list and you don't set the buffer mode option, it will be automatically be converted into JSON and sent as text

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT publish to %s topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT unsubscribe from %s topic %s

block-definition.comment: Open (edit) this block to look at examples how to use the MQTT Extension blocks Background documentation: https://github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap Last source code version (mqtt.xml and mqttExtension.js): https://gitlab.com/cymplecy/Snap/-/tree/master/libraries

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT publish to %s topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

scripts.comment: To execute the examples, single click on blocks, following the corresponding steps.

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT request %s topic %s %br response topic %s payload %mlt %br on response run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT response %s topic %s %br reply %repRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT example response reporter payload %mlt topic %txt
$cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT publish to %s topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT request %s topic %s %br response topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

scripts.comment: Step 2 bis: Send a request (timer acts as idCall) and do not wait for the answer
Step 2 bis: Send a request and do not wait for the answer
Step 1: Activate the responder as a simple subscription
Step 2: Send a request and wait the answer.

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT connect to %s %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT request %s topic %s %br response topic %s payload %mlt %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

scripts.comment: Step 2: Send a request (timer acts as idCall) and wait for the answer

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT request %s topic %s %br response topic %s payload %mlt %br on response run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s

scripts.comment: Asynchronous client-server Hello World! with static response topic (name2)
Synchronous client-server Hello World! with dynamic response topic (timer)
Synchronous client-server Hello World! with static response topic (name2)
Asynchronous client-server Hello World! with dynamic response topic (timer)

block-definition.s: enable move custom block to top

block.l: if( !CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu){ CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu = CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu; } CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu = function(){ var shiftClicked = world.currentKey === 16 ,menu = this._userMenu(); menu.addItem( "move block to top", function (){ var rcvr = this.scriptTarget(), ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), def = this.isGlobal ? this.definition : rcvr.getMethod(this.blockSpec), spec = def.spec; if (this.isGlobal) { ide.stage.globalBlocks = ide.stage.globalBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); ide.stage.globalBlocks.unshift(def); } else { rcvr.customBlocks = rcvr.customBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); rcvr.customBlocks.unshift(def); } ide.flushPaletteCache(); ide.refreshPalette(); ide.recordUnsavedChanges(); } ); return menu; }

if( !CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu){ CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu = CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu; } CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu = function(){ var shiftClicked = world.currentKey === 16 ,menu = this._userMenu(); menu.addItem( "move block to top", function (){ var rcvr = this.scriptTarget(), ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), def = this.isGlobal ? this.definition : rcvr.getMethod(this.blockSpec), spec = def.spec; if (this.isGlobal) { ide.stage.globalBlocks = ide.stage.globalBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); ide.stage.globalBlocks.unshift(def); } else { rcvr.customBlocks = rcvr.customBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); rcvr.customBlocks.unshift(def); } ide.flushPaletteCache(); ide.refreshPalette(); ide.recordUnsavedChanges(); } ); return menu; }

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing %br $options-1-192-192-192 %mult%s
$cloudOutline MQTT unsubscribe from %s topic %s
